thread.title: Palermo president Maurizio Zamparini removes HIMSELF after almost 40 coaching changes in 15 years
thread.title_full: Palermo president Maurizio Zamparini removes HIMSELF after almost 40 coaching changes in 15 years

author: Mark Jones
title: Palermo president Maurizio Zamparini removes HIMSELF after almost 40 coaching changes in 15 years
text:
Sport Palermo president Maurizio Zamparini removes HIMSELF after almost 40 coaching changes in 15 years Football's most ruthless president is walking away after a hiring and firing pretty much EVERYONE in a decade-and-a-half at the club Share Get daily   
Serie A managers can finally breathe a sign of relief, because the division's arch-hirer and firer is finally calling it a day. 
Maurizio Zamparini - the 75-year-old president of Palermo - has announced that he's leaving the club after 15 years in charge, during which he's remarkably made almost 40 coaching changes. 
He's set to step aside for a new owner "within 15 days" with the club sitting 18th in the table, bringing an end to one of the more turbulent periods in Italian top-flight history. These boys have got a new boss (Photo: Valerio Pennicino) Diego Lopez will forever be remembered as the coach who outlasted Zamparini (Photo: Claudio Villa) 
Because amazingly, Zamparini has made ELEVEN coaching changes in the last two seasons alone. 
When he took over the club back in 2002 they were in Serie B, but after promotion in the 2003/04 season he became renowned for hiring and firing more so than anything else. 
And after his most recent appointment of Diego Lopez last month, he's decided to call it a day and make way for a new Anglo-American fund to take over. Zamparini (right) used won't be shaking the hands of any more new arrivals soon (Photo: Tullio M. Puglia) 
"The objective of the investors is to return the club to the position the city deserves, and European football within a three to five year program," read a club statement. 
And presumably sack less managers. Like us on Facebook
